00050 typedef struct GPUBuffer {
00051     int size;   /* in bytes */
00052     void *pointer;  /* used with vertex arrays */
00053     unsigned int id;    /* used with vertex buffer objects */
00054 } GPUBuffer;
00055 
00056 typedef struct GPUBufferMaterial {
00057     /* range of points used for this material */
00058     int start;
00059     int totpoint;
00060 
00061     /* original material index */
00062     short mat_nr;
00063 } GPUBufferMaterial;
00064 
00065 /* meshes are split up by material since changing materials requires
00066  * GL state changes that can't occur in the middle of drawing an
00067  * array.
00068  *
00069  * some simplifying assumptions are made:
00070  * - all quads are treated as two triangles.
00071  * - no vertex sharing is used; each triangle gets its own copy of the
00072  *   vertices it uses (this makes it easy to deal with a vertex used
00073  *   by faces with different properties, such as smooth/solid shading,
00074  *   different MCols, etc.)
00075  *
00076  * to avoid confusion between the original MVert vertices and the
00077  * arrays of OpenGL vertices, the latter are referred to here and in
00078  * the source as `points'. similarly, the OpenGL triangles generated
00079  * for MFaces are referred to as triangles rather than faces.
00080  */
00081 typedef struct GPUDrawObject {
00082     GPUBuffer *points;
00083     GPUBuffer *normals;
00084     GPUBuffer *uv;
00085     GPUBuffer *colors;
00086     GPUBuffer *edges;
00087     GPUBuffer *uvedges;
00088 
00089     /* for each triangle, the original MFace index */
00090     int *triangle_to_mface;
00091 
00092     /* for each original vertex, the list of related points */
00093     struct GPUVertPointLink *vert_points;
00094     /* storage for the vert_points lists */
00095     struct GPUVertPointLink *vert_points_mem;
00096     int vert_points_usage;
00097     
00098     int colType;
00099 
00100     GPUBufferMaterial *materials;
00101     int totmaterial;
00102     
00103     int tot_triangle_point;
00104     int tot_loose_point;
00105     
00106     /* caches of the original DerivedMesh values */
00107     int totvert;
00108     int totedge;
00109 
00110     /* if there was a failure allocating some buffer, use old
00111      * rendering code */
00112     int legacy;
00113 } GPUDrawObject;
00114 
00115 /* used for GLSL materials */
00116 typedef struct GPUAttrib {
00117     int index;
00118     int size;
00119     int type;
00120 } GPUAttrib;

00125 void GPU_buffer_free(GPUBuffer *buffer);

00138 void GPU_interleaved_attrib_setup( GPUBuffer *buffer, GPUAttrib data[], int numdata );

00142 void *GPU_buffer_lock_stream( GPUBuffer *buffer );
00143 void GPU_buffer_unlock( GPUBuffer *buffer );

00145 /* upload three unsigned chars, representing RGB colors, for each vertex. Resets dm->drawObject->colType to -1 */
00146 void GPU_color3_upload(struct DerivedMesh *dm, unsigned char *data );
00147 /* switch color rendering on=1/off=0 */
00148 void GPU_color_switch( int mode );
00149 
00150 /* used for drawing edges */
00151 void GPU_buffer_draw_elements( GPUBuffer *elements, unsigned int mode, int start, int count );
00152 
00153 /* called after drawing */
00154 void GPU_buffer_unbind(void);
00155 
00156 /* used to check whether to use the old (without buffers) code */
00157 int GPU_buffer_legacy(struct DerivedMesh *dm );
